idea-plugin.name: Jumping Lines
idea-plugin.description:
Jumping Lines is a plugin for JetBrains IDEs that allows you to navigate your code more efficiently by jumping multiple lines at once.

With Jumping Lines, you can move your cursor 2 lines upward by pressing Ctrl+Shift+Comma or 4 lines downward by pressing Ctrl+Shift+Period, saving you time and reducing the strain on your hands. You can also jump lines with selection by pressing Ctrl+Shift+Comma for upward and Ctrl+Shift+Period for downward. For jumping on middle of editor, press Ctrl+Comma.

The amount of lines to jump in both directions can also be changed in settings.

Features:
  • Jump multiple lines at once
  • Jump multiple lines at once with selection
  • Jump on a middle line
  • Works with all JetBrains IDEs

Once upon a time when developer of this plugin started using VIM and then he addicted to one of its feature about jumping multiple lines through 5j or 5k and later the developer started developing Android and Kotlin based projects on Jetbrains based IDEs. So he was missing this feature in Jetbrains IDEs in order to be more productive while writing or editing codes. So he developed this useful plugin.

action.description: Place cursor on middle line of editor.
